            if odd[child] is true → append (child+1, crt+1), toggle odd[child].

            else → append (crt+1, child+1), toggle odd[crt].

    visited[crt] = 2.

}

Let me write the C code for the DFS function:

void dfs(int crt, int parent) {

    visited[crt] = 1;

    for (int i = 0; i < adj_size[crt]; i++) {

        int child = adj[crt][i];

        if (child == parent || visited[child] == 1) {

            continue;

        } else if (visited[child] == 2) {

            // append (crt+1, child+1)

            if (first_num == -2) {

                first_num = crt + 1;

            }

            odd[crt] = !odd[crt];

        } else {

            dfs(child, crt);

            if (odd[child]) {

                // append (child+1, crt+1)

                if (first_num == -2) {

                    first_num = child + 1;

                }

                odd[child] = !odd[child];

            } else {

                // append (crt+1, child+1)

                if (first_num == -2) {

                    first_num = crt + 1;

                }

                odd[crt] = !odd[crt];

            }

        }

    }

    visited[crt] = 2;

}

sum function:

int sum(int a) {

    int ans =0;

    while (a >=10) {

        ans += a%10;

        a /=10;

    }

    ans +=a;

    return ans;

}

main:

read N.

compute n = N even → N/2, else (N+1)/2.

ans initialized to sum(1) + sum(N-1).

loop A from 1 to n:

   compute current = sum(A) + sum(N-A).

   if current < ans → update ans.

int N = result;

int n = (N %2 ==0) ? N/2 : (N+1)/2;

int ans = sum(1) + sum(N-1);

for (int A=1; A <=n; A++) {

    int current = sum(A) + sum(N -A);

    if (current < ans) {

        ans = current;

    }

}

printf("%d\n", ans);

#include <stdbool.h>

// Global variables for the first part.

int first_num = -2;

int **adj;

int *adj_size;

int *visited;

bool *odd;

int numNode;

void dfs(int crt, int parent) {

    visited[crt] = 1;

    for (int i = 0; i < adj_size[crt]; i++) {

        int child = adj[crt][i];

        if (child == parent || visited[child] == 1) {

            continue;

        } else if (visited[child] == 2) {

            // append (crt+1, child+1)

            if (first_num == -2) {

                first_num = crt + 1;

            }

            odd[crt] = !odd[crt];

        } else {

            dfs(child, crt);

            if (odd[child]) {

                // append (child+1, crt+1)

                if (first_num == -2) {

                    first_num = child + 1;

                }

                odd[child] = !odd[child];

            } else {

                // append (crt+1, child+1)

                if (first_num == -2) {

                    first_num = crt + 1;

                }

                odd[crt] = !odd[crt];

            }

        }

    }

    visited[crt] = 2;

}

int sum(int a) {

    int ans =0;

    while (a >=10) {

        ans += a%10;

        a /=10;

    }

    ans +=a;

    return ans;

}

int main() {

    int numNode, numEdge;

    scanf("%d %d", &numNode, &numEdge);

    if (numEdge %2 !=0) {

        first_num = -1;

    } else {

        // Read edges and build adjacency lists.

        // First, read all edges into a temporary array.

        struct Edge {

            int a;

            int b;

        };

        struct Edge *edges = malloc(numEdge * sizeof(struct Edge));

        for (int i=0; i < numEdge; i++) {

            int a, b;

            scanf("%d %d", &a, &b);

            a--; b--;

            edges[i].a = a;

            edges[i].b = b;

        }

        // Compute counts for each node.

        int *counts = calloc(numNode, sizeof(int));

        for (int i=0; i < numEdge; i++) {

            counts[edges[i].a]++;

            counts[edges[i].b]++;

        }

        // Allocate adjacency lists.

        adj = malloc(numNode * sizeof(int*));

        adj_size = malloc(numNode * sizeof(int));

        for (int i=0; i < numNode; i++) {

            adj_size[i] = counts[i];

            adj[i] = malloc(counts[i] * sizeof(int));

        }

        // Reset counts to 0 for writing.

        int *index = calloc(numNode, sizeof(int));

        for (int i=0; i < numEdge; i++) {

            int a = edges[i].a;

            int b = edges[i].b;

            adj[a][index[a]++] = b;

            adj[b][index[b]++] = a;

        }

        free(index);

        free(counts);

        free(edges);

        // Initialize visited and odd arrays.

        visited = calloc(numNode, sizeof(int));

        odd = calloc(numNode, sizeof(bool));

        first_num = -2;

        // Call DFS starting at node 0.

        dfs(0, -1);

        free(visited);

        free(odd);

        for (int i=0; i < numNode; i++) {

            free(adj[i]);

        }

        free(adj);

        free(adj_size);

    }

    // Second step: compute result.

    int x = first_num;

    int result = (x ==1) ? 0 : 1;

    // Third step: compute the minimal sum.

    int N = result;

    int n = (N %2 ==0) ? N/2 : (N+1)/2;

    int ans = sum(1) + sum(N-1);

    for (int A=1; A <=n; A++) {

        int current = sum(A) + sum(N - A);

        if (current < ans) {

            ans = current;

        }

    }

    printf("%d\n", ans);

    return 0;

}

    int ans =0;

    while (a >=10) {

        ans += a%10;

        a /=10;

    }

    ans +=a;

    return ans;

}
